summary: This is a proffer agreement between an unnamed client and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, outlining the terms under which the client will provide information to the government on July 12, 2019. The agreement specifies that it is not a cooperation agreement and details the limited protections and potential uses of the client's statements.

persons.name: Joseph Nascimento
persons.context: He is the attorney representing the unnamed client in the proffer meeting with Assistant United States Attorneys.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: He signed the proffer agreement on behalf of the U.S. Attorney's Office.

connections.description: Nascimento is the attorney representing the client in the proffer agreement and meeting with prosecutors.

events.title: Proffer Meeting
events.description: A meeting between an unnamed client, her attorney Joseph Nascimento, and Assistant United States Attorneys, where the client agreed to provide information to the government.

events.title: Continuation of Proffer Meeting
events.description: A continuation of the proffer meeting conducted by video conference.

keyFacts: The document is a proffer agreement for a meeting on July 12, 2019, explicitly stating it is NOT a cooperation agreement.
The client's identity is redacted, but she is represented by attorney Joseph Nascimento, Esq.
The agreement outlines strict limitations on how the government can use the client's statements, with exceptions for prosecutions involving false statements or if the client becomes a fugitive.
The agreement was signed by United States Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman for the Southern District of New York.
The proffer meeting had a continuation on November 5, 2021, conducted by video.
